Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish in a water environment like a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can label plants and animals that live in the water with the fish.
The student can show and label parts of the environment that the fish and other animals need, like water and plants.
The student can use labels to show how fish and other animals depend on water to survive.
The student can illustrate and label how plants and animals, including humans, use natural resources like water.
The student can demonstrate that the fish and its habitat are part of a system where each part helps living things meet their needs.
